Description: Lower body sherd of large Corinthian black-figured pottery lekanis or lekane with turn to foot; interior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of Gorgoneion face in tondo (only three hair curls and part of fourth on forehead, part of eyebrow and eye remaining); exterior: black-figure animal frieze (lower parts of front legs and head of deer remaining), to right; at far right, trace of animal foot; below, two streaky bands, and frieze of fat rays.
Curator's comments: The sherd belongs to the same vase as British Museum 1886,0401.1010, preserving part of the left side of the face of the gorgoneion. For parallels, see British Museum 1861,0425.46.
Bibliographic references: Vase / Catalogue of Vases in the British Museum (B102.8.2)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 90, no. A116)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 217, no. 11)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GB.108) (Phase 1)
